Targeting for 4.2.1, please.

Currently on non-Windows platforms, starting a new RAC instance will terminate an existing RAC or IAC instance.  This is different from the behaviour on Windows.  See bug 144915 for README in 4.2

As a consequence of this, when a user is profiling using IAC and a new instance of RAC is started, the workbench may find itself in a confused state and crash.  I tested it while profiling (via IAC) InOut which has a wait (for console input) before starting RAC.

The workbench terminates with NPE.  
Eugene, I am wondering if the workbench can catch that NPE to avoid crashing?
